text.__SUMMARY__: Mahonia sheridaniana is a shrub in the Berberidaceae described as a species in 1913. It is endemic to China, found in the provinces of Hubei and Sichuan.The species is named in honor of Dr. W.R. Sheridan, formerly of the American Methodist Mission Hospital in Chengtu (Chengdu, 成都市)
